summary: This is an FBI News Briefing dated August 28, 2020, covering a wide range of topics including protests in Kenosha and Minneapolis, political commentary from the 2020 election, various criminal investigations, cybersecurity threats, and international news. It is a daily intelligence summary for senior FBI staff, compiling news reports from numerous media outlets.

persons.name: Kyle Rittenhouse
persons.context: 17-year-old charged with homicide in Kenosha shootings during protests; crossed state lines from Illinois.

persons.name: Jacob Blake
persons.context: Black man shot by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin, sparking widespread protests.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Frequently mentioned in context of protests, law and order messaging, pandemic response, and RNC speech.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Accused Trump of rooting for violence; commented on pandemic response and protests.

persons.name: Jared Kushner
persons.context: Touted Trump's policies on social injustice, pandemic response, and Mideast peace.

persons.name: Kellyanne Conway
persons.context: Quoted saying more chaos helps Trump; commented on Democratic-led cities.

persons.name: Tony Evers
persons.context: Deployed National Guard to Kenosha and requested aid from other states.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.role: Vice President of the United States
persons.context: His commencement speech at Wisconsin Lutheran College was canceled; chief of staff criticized NBA protests.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.role: Former Mayor of New York City
persons.context: Spoke at RNC, accused Democrats of turning peaceful protests violent to hurt Trump.

persons.name: Patrick Lynch
persons.role: President of the NYPD Police Benevolent Association
persons.context: Spoke at RNC, accused Democratic leaders of allowing a public safety disaster in NYC.

persons.name: Mark Meadows
persons.context: Called on Biden to condemn 'Defund the Police'; resumed aid talks with Pelosi.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Resumed coronavirus aid talks with Meadows; said Democrats would release Trump's tax returns if Biden wins.

persons.name: Christopher Steele
persons.context: Testified in London that the FBI did not pay for his dossier research.

persons.name: Jeffrey Rosen
persons.context: Said foreign influence fears should not stop voters; accused media of spreading disinformation.

persons.name: Alexander Yuk Ching Ma
persons.context: Accused of spying for China; ordered detained as a serious flight risk.

persons.name: Peter Rafael Dzibinski Debbins
persons.context: Accused of espionage for Russia; judge declined to free him.

persons.name: Dennis Williams
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy to embezzle union funds in corruption probe.

persons.name: Elon Musk
persons.context: Confirmed a serious cyberattack on the Nevada Tesla factory was thwarted.

persons.name: Vladimir Putin
persons.context: Touted Russia's COVID-19 vaccine; said prepared to help Belarus if protests turn violent.

persons.name: Shinzo Abe
persons.context: Announced resignation due to ill health.

connections.description: Rittenhouse's alleged shootings occurred during protests sparked by the police shooting of Jacob Blake.
Frequently contrasted in the briefing regarding protests, pandemic response, and election messaging.
Kushner is a senior adviser to President Trump, defending and promoting his policies.
Engaged in talks over a coronavirus aid package, though chances for a deal were described as slim.
Steele testified about his relationship with the FBI regarding his dossier research.
Both are former UAW presidents charged in the same corruption probe.

events.title: Kenosha Shooting of Jacob Blake
events.description: Jacob Blake was shot by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin, leading to widespread protests.

events.title: Kenosha Protest Shootings
events.description: Kyle Rittenhouse allegedly shot and killed two people during protests in Kenosha.

events.title: RNC Speech by Donald Trump
events.description: President Trump delivered his nomination speech at the Republican National Convention.

events.title: Operation Not Forgotten
events.description: U.S. Marshals and Georgia investigators rescued 39 missing children in Georgia.

events.title: Hurricane Laura Landfall
events.description: Hurricane Laura made landfall in Louisiana as a Category 4 hurricane, causing significant damage.

events.title: NBA Players Boycott
events.description: NBA players boycotted games in protest of the Jacob Blake shooting, then voted to resume play.

events.title: White House Shooting Incident
events.description: A man was shot by a Secret Service officer outside the White House; he was later found to be holding a comb, not a gun.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI internal news briefing summarizing major news stories from August 27, 2020.
Extensive coverage is given to protests and violence in Kenosha, WI, following the police shooting of Jacob Blake and the subsequent shootings allegedly by Kyle Rittenhouse.
The briefing includes numerous criminal investigations, including the rescue of 39 missing children in Georgia and charges against former UAW President Dennis Williams.
Cybersecurity threats are highlighted, including a thwarted attack on a Tesla factory and the DOJ's move to seize cryptocurrency accounts tied to North Korean hacks.
International news includes the suspected poisoning of Alexei Navalny, tensions between Greece and Turkey, and the resignation of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.
